definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns

sentences.english: his head thrown back against a telephone pole.
sentences.chinese: 他在睡觉，他的头后仰靠在电线杆上。

sentences.english: Virgin Media has started trials to deliver fibre-optic high-speed broadband over telegraph poles.
sentences.chinese: 维珍传媒已开始试验使用电线杆架设高速光纤宽带。

sentences.english: That was how our activity Dressing the Wire Pole came out.
sentences.chinese: 于是便有了我们“为电线杆穿绿装”的行动。

sentences.english: Telegraph poles are blurry, not so much pacing out the landscape as shimmying across it.
sentences.chinese: 模糊的电线杆无法在踩着狐步飘然而过时量出画面。

sentences.english: Hwang hurried escape and hit the pole lying on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 黄某慌忙逃跑，撞上电线杆倒地。

sentences.english: He told me he was holding a wire pole.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉我正抓着一根电线杆。

sentences.english: She banged up against the pole.
sentences.chinese: 她砰地一声撞在电线杆上。

sentences.english: The car reversed into a lamp-post.
sentences.chinese: 汽车倒车撞到一根电线杆子上。

sentences.english: The car went into a pole and was severely damaged.
sentences.chinese: 汽车撞上了一根电线杆，损坏十分严重。

sentences.english: He walked into a lamp-post while reading.
sentences.chinese: 他边走边看书，撞到电线杆了。
